page.title: 08Transport - Building the M6
page.content:
The section of motorway in the block was part of the section from Hanchurch to Lymm. To build this 33 miles of motorway, 1110 acres of land were acquired and 10,392,000 tons of earth were moved. The maximum labour force was 3,680 and the motorway was designed for 3 lanes of traffic at speeds of up to 75 mph.
The construction of the motorway was done by 3 major civil engineering contractors, John Laing Constr. Ltd., Sir Lindsey Parkinson & Co. Ltd. and Tarmac Civil Engineering Ltd..
Two groups of boys surveyed the traffic on the motorway their report is on pages 9 & 10 together with a survey prepared by the school in 1981.
